sense.name: intrinsic or fundamental nature of something
sense.examples: Conflict is the essence of drama. The faces of those children are the essence of innocence. The photographer has really captured the essence of the landscape.

sense.name: the core content of a communication, gist
sense.examples: Anti-globalization is the essence of that candidate's political platform. The essence of the story is how the heroine overcomes the obstacles of a class society. What was the essence of the minister's sermon today?

sense.name: substance which is a volatile extract used as flavoring or scent
sense.examples: This perfume has rose and jasmine essence as major ingredients. The spice shop sells fresh and dried herbs, as well as aromatic herbal essences.

sense.name: basically, fundamentally
sense.examples: The details of the proof are complex, but in essence, the idea is simple. In essence, they have created a trade barrier with this legislation.

sense.name: critically important
sense.examples: Time is of the essence in this matter.
